## Po VeÄeÅ™i: Aktivity A ZÃ¡bava (36-45)

Co dÄ›lat po jÃ­dle? Tyto frÃ¡ze vÃ¡m pomohou naplÃ¡novat dalÅ¡Ã­ ÄÃ¡st veÄera.

## IntimnÃ­ OkamÅ¾iky A ZÃ¡vÄ›r VeÄera (46-55)

Pro ty nejromantiÄtÄ›jÅ¡Ã­ momenty veÄera:

## Jak PouÅ¾Ã­vat Tato Slova Na Rande

### Tipy Pro ÃšspÄ›Å¡nÃ© PouÅ¾itÃ­:

2. **ZaÄnÄ›te jednoduÅ¡e** - Don't try to use all phrases at once. Pick 3-5 favorites and master those first.

3. **Poslouchejte vÃ½slovnost** - Use our app's audio features to perfect your pronunciation. Your partner will be impressed!

4. **BuÄte autentiÄtÃ­** - Use phrases that feel natural to your relationship. If you're not typically super romantic, start with the simpler compliments.

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡±" title="PolskÃ¡ Rande Etiketa">

S tÄ›mito vÃ­ce neÅ¾ 50 polskÃ½mi slovy pro rande jste pÅ™ipraveni vytvoÅ™it nezapomenutelnÃ© veÄery plnÃ© lÃ¡sky a spojenÃ­. Od prvnÃ­ho pozdravu po poslednÃ­ polibek dobrÃ© noci - kaÅ¾dÃ© slovo vÃ¡s pÅ™ibliÅ¾uje k sobÄ› navzÃ¡jem a k polskÃ© kultuÅ™e.

articles.title: 50+ Portugalskich ZwrotÃ³w na RomantycznÄ… RandkÄ™
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

Randka po portugalsku to poÅ‚Ä…czenie ciepÅ‚a, muzyki fado i pysznego jedzenia! Oto sÅ‚ownictwo na niezapomniany wieczÃ³r.

## Zapraszanie na randkÄ™

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Queres sair comigo esta noite?"
  translation="Chcesz dziÅ› wieczorem Å¼e mnÄ… wyjÅ›Ä‡?"
  pronunciation="ke-resz sa-ir ko-mi-gu esz-ta noj-te"
  context="Klasyczne zaproszenie na randkÄ™"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Tens planos para logo?** | tesz pla-nusz pa-ra lo-gu | Masz plany na pÃ³Åºniej? |
| **Quero convidar-te para jantar** | ke-ru kon-wi-dar-te pa-ra Å¼an-tar | ChcÄ™ zaprosiÄ‡ ciÄ™ na kolacjÄ™ |
| **Que tal um jantar?** | ke tal um Å¼an-tar | Co powiesz na kolacjÄ™? |
| **Reservei uma mesa** | re-zer-wej u-ma me-za | ZarezerwowaÅ‚em stolik |
| **Eu pago** | eu pa-gu | Ja stawiam |

## W restauracji

<VocabCard
  word="Uma mesa para dois, por favor"
  translation="Stolik dla dwojga, proszÄ™"
  pronunciation="u-ma me-za pa-ra dojsz, por fa-wor"
  example="Boa noite. Uma mesa para dois, por favor."
/>

### Zamawianie

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **A ementa, por favor** | a e-men-ta, por fa-wor | Menu, proszÄ™ |
| **O que recomenda?** | u ke re-ko-men-da | Co polecacie? |
| **Quero...** | ke-ru | PoproszÄ™... |
| **Para mim...** | pa-ra mim | Dla mnie... |
| **A conta, por favor** | a kon-ta, por fa-wor | Rachunek, proszÄ™ |

<CultureTip title="Portugalska kolacja" flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹">
W Portugalii kolacja jest pÃ³Åºno - czÄ™sto o 20:00-21:00. PosiÅ‚ki sÄ… towarzyskie i trwajÄ… dÅ‚ugo. Nie Å›piesz siÄ™ - to czas na rozmowÄ™ i relaks!
</CultureTip>

### Przy stole

<VocabCard
  word="SaÃºde!"
  translation="Na zdrowie!"
  pronunciation="sa-u-de"
  example="SaÃºde! Ã€ nossa!"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **SaÃºde!** | sa-u-de | Na zdrowie! |
| **Ã€ nossa!** | a no-sa | Za nas! |
| **Bom apetite!** | bom a-pe-ti-te | Smacznego! |
| **EstÃ¡ delicioso!** | esz-ta de-li-sio-zu | Pyszne! |
| **EstÃ¡ Ã³timo!** | esz-ta o-ti-mu | WyÅ›mienite! |

## Komplimenty na randce

<PhraseOfDay
  word="EstÃ¡s linda esta noite"
  translation="WyglÄ…dasz dziÅ› piÄ™knie"
  pronunciation="esz-tasz lin-da esz-ta noj-te"
  context="Elegancki komplement"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **EstÃ¡s muito bonito/a** | esz-tasz mui-tu bo-ni-tu | WyglÄ…dasz bardzo Å‚adnie |
| **Esse vestido fica-te bem** | e-se wesz-ti-du fi-ka-te bem | Ta sukienka dobrze ci leÅ¼y |
| **Cheiras bem** | szej-rasz bem | Åadnie pachniesz |
| **Adoro o teu sorriso** | a-do-ru u teu so-ri-zu | Uwielbiam twÃ³j uÅ›miech |
| **Tens olhos lindos** | tesz o-liusz lin-dusz | Masz piÄ™kne oczy |

## Rozmowa przy kolacji

<VocabCard
  word="Conta-me sobre o teu dia"
  translation="Opowiedz mi o swoim dniu"
  pronunciation="kon-ta-me so-bre u teu dzia"
  example="Amor, conta-me sobre o teu dia."
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **O que gostas de fazer?** | u ke gosz-tasz de fa-zer | Co lubisz robiÄ‡? |
| **Qual Ã© o teu filme favorito?** | kwal e u teu fil-me fa-wo-ri-tu | Jaki jest twÃ³j ulubiony film? |
| **Onde gostarias de viajar?** | on-de gosz-ta-ri-asz de wia-Å¼ar | Gdzie chciaÅ‚byÅ› podrÃ³Å¼owaÄ‡? |
| **Quais sÃ£o os teus sonhos?** | kwaisz saÅ‚ usz teusz so-niusz | Jakie masz marzenia? |

<CultureTip title="Fado - muzyka saudade" flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹">
Fado to tradycyjna portugalska muzyka wyraÅ¼ajÄ…ca "saudade" - tÄ™sknotÄ™. Romantyczna kolacja w domu fado to niezapomniane przeÅ¼ycie! Lizbona sÅ‚ynie z takich miejsc.
</CultureTip>

## Na spacerze

<VocabCard
  word="Vamos passear?"
  translation="ChodÅºmy na spacer?"
  pronunciation="wa-musz pa-se-ar"
  example="O jantar foi Ã³timo. Vamos passear?"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Que noite linda** | ke noj-te lin-da | Jaka piÄ™kna noc |
| **Olha as estrelas** | o-lia asz esz-tre-lasz | SpÃ³jrz na gwiazdy |
| **DÃ¡-me a mÃ£o** | da-me a maÅ‚ | Daj mi rÄ™kÄ™ |
| **Sentamo-nos aqui?** | sen-ta-mu-nusz a-ki | UsiÄ…dziemy tutaj? |
| **Gosto de passear contigo** | gosz-tu de pa-se-ar kon-ti-gu | LubiÄ™ z tobÄ… spacerowaÄ‡ |

## Romantyczne zakoÅ„czenie

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Foi uma noite perfeita"
  translation="To byÅ‚ idealny wieczÃ³r"
  pronunciation="foj u-ma noj-te per-fej-ta"
  context="Podsumowanie romantycznego wieczoru"
/>

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **Diverti-me muito** | di-wer-ti-me mui-tu | Åšwietnie siÄ™ bawiÅ‚em/am |
| **NÃ£o quero que a noite acabe** | naÅ‚ ke-ru ke a noj-te a-ka-be | Nie chcÄ™, Å¼eby noc siÄ™ koÅ„czyÅ‚a |
| **Quando nos vemos de novo?** | kwan-du nusz we-musz de no-wu | Kiedy siÄ™ znowu zobaczymy? |
| **Levo-te a casa** | le-wu-te a ka-za | OdprowadzÄ™ ciÄ™ do domu |

## Portugalskie dania na randkÄ™

### Typowe dania

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **bacalhau** | ba-ka-liau | dorsz solony |
| **sardinhas** | sar-di-niasz | sardynki |
| **caldo verde** | kal-du wer-de | zupa z jarmuÅ¼u |
| **francesinha** | fran-se-zi-nia | kanapka z Porto |
| **pastÃ©is de nata** | pasz-tejsz de na-ta | ciastka z kremem |

### Wina

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **vinho tinto** | wi-niu tin-tu | wino czerwone |
| **vinho branco** | wi-niu bran-ku | wino biaÅ‚e |
| **vinho verde** | wi-niu wer-de | wino zielone (mÅ‚ode) |
| **porto** | por-tu | porto |

<CultureTip title="Bacalhau - dorsz narodowy" flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¹">
Portugalczycy mÃ³wiÄ…, Å¼e majÄ… 365 przepisÃ³w na dorsza - jeden na kaÅ¼dy dzieÅ„ roku! Bacalhau to narodowe danie Portugalii.
</CultureTip>

## Miejsca na randkÄ™

| Portugalski | Wymowa | Polski |
|-------------|--------|--------|
| **restaurante** | resz-tau-ran-te | restauracja |
| **tasca** | tasz-ka | tradycyjna tawerna |
| **casa de fado** | ka-za de fa-du | dom fado |
| **cafÃ©** | ka-fe | kawiarnia |
| **pastelaria** | pasz-te-la-ri-a | cukiernia |

## Ä†wiczenia dla par

### Ä†wiczenie 1: Rezerwacja
PrzeÄ‡wiczcie telefonicznÄ… rezerwacjÄ™ stolika po portugalsku.

### Ä†wiczenie 2: Zamawianie
Zagrajcie scenÄ™ zamawiania w restauracji - jeden kelner, drugi goÅ›Ä‡.

### Ä†wiczenie 3: Planowanie
Zaplanujcie randkÄ™ po portugalsku:
- Onde vamos? (Gdzie idziemy?)
- A que horas? (O ktÃ³rej?)
- O que comemos? (Co jemy?)

## Podsumowanie

Portugalska randka to czas na rozmowÄ™, pyszne jedzenie i saudade! PamiÄ™tajcie o portugalskim tempie - nie Å›pieszcie siÄ™, cieszcie siÄ™ chwilÄ…!

## Kontynuuj naukÄ™

- **[Portugalskie zdrobnienia](/learn/pl/pt/portuguese-pet-names-terms-of-endearment/)** - CzuÅ‚e sÅ‚owa
- **[Romantyczne okazje](/learn/pl/pt/portuguese-romantic-phrases-every-occasion/)** - Specjalne chwile
- **[Jak powiedzieÄ‡ "kocham ciÄ™"](/learn/pl/pt/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-portuguese/)** - Wyznania miÅ‚oÅ›ci
- **[Spotkanie z rodzinÄ…](/learn/pl/pt/meeting-your-portuguese-partners-family/)** - WaÅ¼ne zwroty

<CTA text="Ä†wicz wymowÄ™ z AI, zapisuj sÅ‚Ã³wka do Love Log i wysyÅ‚aj Word Gifts swojej drugiej poÅ‚Ã³wce. Love Languages Å‚Ä…czy pary w nauce jÄ™zykÃ³w." buttonText="Rozpocznij naukÄ™ portugalskiego" />

articles.title: Czech Pronunciation for Couples: Sound Romantic from Day One
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Nothing melts your partner's heart like hearing their native language spoken with love. Czech pronunciation might seem intimidating with its hÃ¡Äeks and accents, but here's the secret: it's actually more logical than English! By the end of this guide, you'll confidently say romantic Czech phrases that make your partner smileâ€”and avoid the common mistakes that make native speakers cringe.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Miluji tÄ›"
  translation="I love you"
  pronunciation="MEE-loo-yee tyeh"
  context="The most important phrase to pronounce perfectly. The stress is on the first syllable: MI-loo-yee tyeh."
/>

## Why Czech Pronunciation Matters for Couples

Getting Czech sounds right shows respect for your partner's culture. When you pronounce "miluji tÄ›" correctly, you're not just saying wordsâ€”you're showing you care enough to get it right. Plus, Czech has some beautiful sounds that don't exist in English, and mastering them together can be a fun bonding experience. Ready to sound like you belong in Prague?

## The Czech Alphabet: Your New Best Friends

Czech uses the Latin alphabet with a few special characters. Think of these as bonus letters that make you sound more authentic:

### Vowels: Short vs. Long
Czech vowels can be short or long (marked with an accent). This changes everything:

| Short | Pronunciation | Long | Pronunciation |
|-------|---------------|------|---------------|
| a | like "a" in "car" | Ã¡ | like "a" in "father" (held longer) |
| e | like "e" in "bed" | Ã© | like "e" in "cafÃ©" (held longer) |
| i/y | like "i" in "machine" | Ã­/Ã½ | like "ee" in "see" (held longer) |
| o | like "o" in "hot" | Ã³ | like "aw" in "law" (held longer) |
| u | like "u" in "put" | Ãº/Å¯ | like "oo" in "moon" (held longer) |

<VocabCard
  word="mÅ¯j"
  translation="my/mine"
  pronunciation="moo-ee"
  example="To je mÅ¯j partner."
/>

### Those Tricky Czech Consonants

Some Czech consonants will be new friends. Here's how to make them:

**Ä** = "ch" in "cheese" - **Äaj** (tea) = "chah-ee"
**Å¡** = "sh" in "shoe" - **Å¡Å¥astnÃ½** (happy) = "shtahst-nee"
**Å¾** = "s" in "measure" - **Å¾ena** (woman) = "zheh-nah"
**Å™** = the famous Czech sound! Mix "r" + "zh" - **Å™eka** (river) = "r-zheh-kah"
**Ä** = "d" + "y" sound - **ÄÃ¡bel** (devil) = "dyah-bel"

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿" title="The Å™ Challenge">
Don't worry if Å™ doesn't come naturally! Even some native speakers struggle with it. Your partner will appreciate the effort, and you can practice together by starting with "r" then adding the "zh" sound from "measure."
</CultureTip>

## Stress Patterns: Where to Put the Emphasis

Here's the beautiful simplicity: **Czech always stresses the first syllable**. Always.

- **MIL**-u-ji tÄ› (not mi-LU-ji tÄ›)
- **RO**-mÃ¡n-tickÃ½ (romantic)
- **PÅ˜Ã**-tel (boyfriend)

This makes Czech wonderfully predictable compared to English!

## Romantic Sounds: Practice Together

Let's practice some sounds you'll use in romantic contexts:

### Soft vs. Hard Sounds
Czech distinguishes between soft and hard consonants, which affects how words sound:

| Hard Sound | Example | Soft Sound | Example |
|------------|---------|------------|---------|
| d | **d**Å¯m (house) | Ä | **Ä**Ã¡bel (devil) |
| t | **t**am (there) | Å¥ | **Å¥**uk (knock) |
| n | **n**os (nose) | Åˆ | **Åˆ**e (no, archaic) |

<VocabCard
  word="lÃ¡ska"
  translation="love"
  pronunciation="lahss-kah"
  example="Moje lÃ¡ska k tobÄ› je velkÃ¡."
/>

## Common Czech Sound Combinations

Some sounds appear frequently in romantic phrases:

**-ej** ending = "ay" sound - **milÃ½** (dear) = "MEE-lay"
**-Ã½** ending = "ee" sound - **krÃ¡snÃ½** (beautiful) = "KRAHS-nee"
**Äk-** = "ch" + "k" - **ÄlovÄ›k** (person) = "CHLOH-vek"

## Putting It Together: Romantic Practice

Practice these couple-focused phrases with perfect pronunciation:

| Czech Phrase | Translation | Pronunciation Guide |
|--------------|-------------|---------------------|
| Jsi krÃ¡snÃ¡ | You're beautiful (to woman) | "Yee-sih KRAHS-nah" |
| Jsi krÃ¡snÃ½ | You're handsome (to man) | "Yee-sih KRAHS-nee" |
| ChybÃ­Å¡ mi | I miss you | "KHIB-eesh mee" |
| Jsi mÅ¯j svÄ›t | You're my world | "Yee-sih moo-ee svyet" |
| MÃ¡m tÄ› rÃ¡d/rÃ¡da | I like/love you | "Mahm tyeh raht/RAH-dah" |

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿" title="Gender Matters in Czech">
Notice how krÃ¡snÃ¡/krÃ¡snÃ½ and rÃ¡d/rÃ¡da change based on who you're talking to? Czech adjectives agree with gender. When complimenting your partner, make sure to use the right form!
</CultureTip>

## Pronunciation Pitfalls to Avoid

### 1. The "Y" vs. "I" Trap
In Czech, **y** and **i** sound identical (like "ee" in "see"), but they affect surrounding consonants. Don't overthink itâ€”focus on getting the "ee" sound right first.

### 2. Final Consonants
Czech consonants at word endings are **fully pronounced**. No silent letters!
- **milovat** (to love) = "MEE-loh-vaht" (not "MEE-loh-vah")

### 3. The "Ch" Sound
Czech **ch** is a soft guttural sound, like in Scottish "loch" or German "Bach". Not "ch" in "cheese"!

<VocabCard
  word="pÅ™Ã­telkynÄ›"
  translation="girlfriend"
  pronunciation="pree-tehl-kee-nyeh"
  example="To je moje pÅ™Ã­telkynÄ›."
/>

## Quick Pronunciation Reference

Save this cheat sheet for daily practice:

### Vowel Length
- **Ã¡, Ã©, Ã­, Ã³, Ãº, Å¯** = hold the sound longer
- **a, e, i, o, u, y** = short and crisp

### Special Characters
- **Ä** = ch, **Å¡** = sh, **Å¾** = zh (like measure)
- **Å™** = r + zh together
- **Ä, Å¥, Åˆ** = soft versions of d, t, n

### Always Remember
- **First syllable stress**
- **No silent letters**
- **Practice with your partner**

## Practice Makes Perfect: Daily Exercises

Try these tongue twisters together (start slow!):

1. **"StrÄ prst skrz krk"** (stick finger through throat) - "strch prst skrz krk"
2. **"TÅ™i sta tÅ™icet tÅ™i"** (333) - "tr-zhee stah tr-zhee-tset tr-zhee"

For more romantic practice, check out our guides to [Czech pet names for your partner](/learn/en/cs/czech-pet-names-for-your-partner/) and [romantic Czech phrases for every occasion](/learn/en/cs/romantic-czech-phrases-for-every-occasion/).

## Your Next Steps

You've got the basics! Now it's time to practice with real phrases. Start with [essential Czech phrases for couples](/learn/en/cs/essential-czech-phrases-for-couples/) to build your conversation skills, or dive into [daily conversations for couples](/learn/en/cs/czech-daily-conversations-couples/) to practice these pronunciation rules in context.

Remember: your partner fell in love with YOU, not your pronunciation. But making the effort to sound authentic? That's pure romance.

<CTA />

articles.title: MÃ¶ta din partners tjeckiska familj: Essentiella fraser fÃ¶r nervÃ¶sa svÃ¤rfÃ¶rÃ¤ldrar
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Att mÃ¶ta din partners familj fÃ¶r fÃ¶rsta gÃ¥ngen Ã¤r alltid nervÃ¶st â€“ och nÃ¤r de dessutom pratar ett annat sprÃ¥k kan det kÃ¤nnas Ã¶vervÃ¤ldigande. Men oroa dig inte! Denna guide ger dig de viktigaste tjeckiska fraserna och kulturella insikterna du behÃ¶ver fÃ¶r att gÃ¶ra ett fantastiskt fÃ¶rsta intryck. Tillsammans med din partner kan ni Ã¶va dessa fraser och skapa en varm connection med deras familj frÃ¥n fÃ¶rsta stund.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="RÃ¡d vÃ¡s poznÃ¡vÃ¡m"
  translation="Trevligt att trÃ¤ffas"
  pronunciation="rahd vahs pohz-NAH-vahm"
  context="Denna artighetsfras kommer att bli din bÃ¤sta vÃ¤n nÃ¤r du hÃ¤lsar pÃ¥ varje familjemedlem."
/>

## Innan ni Ã¥ker: FÃ¶rbered er tillsammans

Att fÃ¶rbereda sig som ett team gÃ¶r allt lÃ¤ttare. Ã–va dessa fraser tillsammans hemma, och be din partner fÃ¶rklara familjens dynamik. Kom ihÃ¥g att tjecker uppskattar nÃ¤r man gÃ¶r en Ã¤rlig anstrÃ¤ngning att tala deras sprÃ¥k â€“ perfektion Ã¤r inte nÃ¶dvÃ¤ndigt!

<VocabCard
  word="Rodina"
  translation="Familj"
  pronunciation="ROH-dee-nah"
  example="VaÅ¡e rodina je moc milÃ¡." (Er familj Ã¤r sÃ¥ trevlig.)
/>

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿" title="Viktiga hÃ¤lsningsregler">
I Tjeckien Ã¤r det viktigt att hÃ¤lsa pÃ¥ varje person individuellt nÃ¤r ni anlÃ¤nder. En fast handskakning med Ã¶gonkontakt fÃ¶r mÃ¤n, och ett leende med lÃ¤tt huvudnick fÃ¶r kvinnor. VÃ¤nta inte pÃ¥ att bli presenterad â€“ ta initiativet!
</CultureTip>

## Essentiella hÃ¤lsningsfraser

| Tjeckiska | Uttal | Svenska | NÃ¤r man anvÃ¤nder det |
|-----------|---------|----------|---------------------|
| **DobrÃ½ den** | DOH-bree dehn | God dag | Formell hÃ¤lsning, fungerar hela dagen |
| **DobrÃ½ veÄer** | DOH-bree VEH-cher | God kvÃ¤ll | PÃ¥ kvÃ¤llen efter 18:00 |
| **Ahoj** | AH-hoy | Hej | Informellt, med vÃ¤nner och familj |
| **Na shledanou** | nah-SKLEH-dah-noh | Hej dÃ¥ | NÃ¤r ni lÃ¤mnar |
| **Jak se mÃ¡te?** | yahk seh MAH-teh | Hur mÃ¥r ni? | Artigt sÃ¤tt att visa intresse |
| **Moc rÃ¡d vÃ¡s poznÃ¡vÃ¡m** | mohts rahd vahs pohz-NAH-vahm | Mycket trevligt att trÃ¤ffas er | NÃ¤r ni mÃ¶ts fÃ¶rsta gÃ¥ngen |
| **Jsem [namn]** | ysehm [NAMN] | Jag Ã¤r [namn] | Presentera dig sjÃ¤lv |
| **Odkud jste?** | OHD-kood ysteh | Var kommer ni ifrÃ¥n? | NÃ¤r de visar intresse fÃ¶r dig |

## Specifika scenario: Middag hos familjen

### NÃ¤r ni anlÃ¤nder till huset

**Vy**: *"DobrÃ½ veÄer, moc rÃ¡d vÃ¡s poznÃ¡vÃ¡m. Jsem [ditt namn]."*
(God kvÃ¤ll, mycket trevligt att trÃ¤ffas er. Jag Ã¤r [ditt namn].)

**Partnerns mamma**: *"VÃ­tejte! Jak se mÃ¡te?"*
(VÃ¤lkommen! Hur mÃ¥r ni?)

**Vy**: *"DÄ›kuji, mÃ¡m se dobÅ™e. A vy?"*
(Tack, jag mÃ¥r bra. Och ni?)

### Vid middagsbordet

<VocabCard
  word="Dobrou chuÅ¥"
  translation="Smaklig mÃ¥ltid"
  pronunciation="DOH-broh khoot"
  example="VÅ¾dycky Å™eknu 'dobrou chuÅ¥' pÅ™ed jÃ­dlem." (Jag sÃ¤ger alltid 'smaklig mÃ¥ltid' fÃ¶re maten.)
/>

| Tjeckiska | Uttal | Svenska | AnvÃ¤ndning |
|-----------|---------|----------|------------|
| **Dobrou chuÅ¥** | DOH-broh khoot | Smaklig mÃ¥ltid | Innan ni bÃ¶rjar Ã¤ta |
| **Je to vÃ½bornÃ©** | yeh toh VEE-borh-neh | Det Ã¤r utsÃ¶kt | BerÃ¶m maten |
| **Moc mi chutnÃ¡** | mohts mee KHOOT-nah | Jag tycker mycket om det | Visa uppskattning |
| **DÄ›kuji za veÄeÅ™i** | DYEH-koo-yee zah VEH-cheh-ree | Tack fÃ¶r middagen | Efter mÃ¥ltiden |
| **Mohl bych dostat vodu?** | mohwl bikh DOH-staht VOH-doo | Skulle jag kunna fÃ¥ vatten? | Be om nÃ¥got artigt |

## SamtalsÃ¤mnen och komplimanger

Tjecker uppskattar nÃ¤r man visar Ã¤kta intresse fÃ¶r deras kultur och hem. AnvÃ¤nd dessa fraser fÃ¶r att skapa varma samtal:

- *"MÃ¡te krÃ¡snÃ½ byt/domov"* (Ni har en vacker lÃ¤genhet/hem) - mah-teh KRAH-snih biht/DOH-mohf
- *"VaÅ¡e rodina je moc pÅ™Ã­jemnÃ¡"* (Er familj Ã¤r sÃ¥ trevlig) - vah-sheh ROH-dee-nah yeh mohts PREE-yehm-nah
- *"ObrÃ¡zky jsou krÃ¡snÃ©"* (Fotografierna Ã¤r vackra) - OH-brah-skee YSOH KRAH-sneh
- *"VaÅ¡e vaÅ™enÃ­ je vynikajÃ­cÃ­"* (Er matlagning Ã¤r utmÃ¤rkt) - vah-sheh VAH-zheh-nee yeh VIH-nee-kah-yee-chee

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿" title="Presentetikett">
Ta alltid med en liten gÃ¥va nÃ¤r ni besÃ¶ker nÃ¥gons hem. Blommor, choklad eller en flaska vin uppskattas. Om du ger blommor, ge allta ett udda antal (utom 13!) och ta bort omslaget innan du ger dem.
</CultureTip>

## Ordlista: Familjemedlemmar

| Tjeckiska | Uttal | Svenska |
|-----------|---------|----------|
| **maminka/matka** | MAH-meen-kah/MAHT-kah | mamma/mor |
| **tatÃ­nek/otec** | TAH-tee-nehk/OH-tehts | pappa/far |
| **babiÄka** | BAH-beech-kah | mormor/farmor |
| **dÄ›deÄek** | DYEH-deh-chehk | morfar/farfar |
| **sestra** | SEH-strah | syster |
| **bratr** | BRAH-tr | bror |
| **syn** | sihn | son |
| **dcera** | TSEH-rah | dotter |

## Artiga fraser och formalitet

Att visa respekt genom artiga formuleringar Ã¤r sÃ¤rskilt viktigt nÃ¤r man trÃ¤ffar Ã¤ldre familjemedlemmar:

<VocabCard
  word="ProsÃ­m"
  translation="VarsÃ¥god/tack/snÃ¤lla"
  pronunciation="PROH-seem"
  example="ProsÃ­m, posaÄte se." (VarsÃ¥god, sitt ner.)
/>

| Formellt | Informellt | Svenska |
|----------|------------|----------|
| **S dovolenÃ­m** | **PromiÅˆte** | UrsÃ¤kta |
| **Mohu se zeptat?** | **MÅ¯Å¾u se zeptat?** | FÃ¥r jag frÃ¥ga? |
| **Jste velice laskavÃ­** | **Jsi moc hodnÃ½** | Ni Ã¤r mycket vÃ¤nlig/vÃ¤nlig |
| **DÄ›kuji mnohokrÃ¡t** | **DÃ­ky moc** | Tack sÃ¥ mycket |

## Om nÃ¥got gÃ¥r fel

Ibland hÃ¤nder det att man inte fÃ¶rstÃ¥r eller behÃ¶ver hjÃ¤lp. Dessa fraser rÃ¤ddar situationen:

- *"PromiÅˆte, nerozumÃ­m"* (UrsÃ¤kta, jag fÃ¶rstÃ¥r inte) - PROH-meen-teh, NEH-roh-zoo-meem
- *"MÅ¯Å¾ete to zopakovat, prosÃ­m?"* (Kan ni upprepa det, snÃ¤lla?) - MOO-zheh-teh toh ZOH-pah-koh-vaht, PROH-seem
- *"MluvÃ­te anglicky?"* (Pratar ni engelska?) - MLOO-vee-teh AHN-glee-skee
- *"Mohu pouÅ¾Ã­t toaletu?"* (FÃ¥r jag anvÃ¤nda toaletten?) - MOH-hoo POH-zheeht toh-ah-LEH-too

<VocabCard
  word="NevadÃ­"
  translation="Det gÃ¶r inget"
  pronunciation="NEH-vah-dee"
  example="NevadÃ­, rozumÃ­m teÄ." (Det gÃ¶r inget, jag fÃ¶rstÃ¥r nu.)
/>

## Proffstips fÃ¶r att imponera

1. **LÃ¤r dig uttalet av familjens efternamn korrekt** â€“ be din partner Ã¶va med dig flera gÃ¥nger.

2. **FÃ¶rbered en kort historia om dig sjÃ¤lv** pÃ¥ tjeckiska: var du kommer ifrÃ¥n, vad du arbetar med, och hur ni trÃ¤ffades.

3. **Komplimangera maten specifikt**: "Miluji bramborovÃ½ salÃ¡t" (Jag Ã¤lskar potatissalladen) - MEE-loo-vee BRAHM-boh-roh-vee sah-LAHT

4. **Visa intresse fÃ¶r tjeckiska traditioner** â€“ frÃ¥ga om deras favorithelg eller matrÃ¤tt.

5. **Ta med en liten gÃ¥va frÃ¥n Sverige** som vÃ¤rdinnan kan njuta av senare.

6. **Ã–va pÃ¥ att sÃ¤ga "na zdravÃ­"** (naz-DRAH-vee) â€“ "skÃ¥l" â€“ innan ni dricker.

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¿" title="SkÃ¥la som en lokal">
NÃ¤r ni skÃ¥lar, se alltid personen i Ã¶gonen och sÃ¤g "na zdravÃ­". Det anses ofÃ¶rskÃ¤mt att inte ha Ã¶gonkontakt under skÃ¥len!
</CultureTip>

## Snabbreferens: Topp 10 fraser att memorera

1. **RÃ¡d vÃ¡s poznÃ¡vÃ¡m** - Trevligt att trÃ¤ffas
2. **DobrÃ½ veÄer** - God kvÃ¤ll
3. **DÄ›kuji za veÄeÅ™i** - Tack fÃ¶r middagen
4. **Je to vÃ½bornÃ©** - Det Ã¤r utsÃ¶kt
5. **VaÅ¡e rodina je moc milÃ¡** - Er familj Ã¤r sÃ¥ trevlig
6. **ProsÃ­m** - VarsÃ¥god
7. **PromiÅˆte** - UrsÃ¤kta
8. **Jak se mÃ¡te?** - Hur mÃ¥r ni?
9. **Na shledanou** - Hej dÃ¥
10. **Dobrou chuÅ¥** - Smaklig mÃ¥ltid

Att mÃ¶ta din partners tjeckiska familj behÃ¶ver inte vara skrÃ¤mmande. Med dessa fraser i din verktygslÃ¥da och din partner vid din sida, Ã¤r du redo att skapa varma minnen och bygga starka relationer. Kom ihÃ¥g: Ã¤rliga anstrÃ¤ngningar uppskattas alltid mer Ã¤n perfekt grammatik!

articles.title: Films Romantiques Polonais Ã  Voir
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Regarder des **filmy romantyczne** (films romantiques) ensemble est l'une des faÃ§ons les plus agrÃ©ables pour les couples de s'immerger dans la culture et la langue polonaises. Le cinÃ©ma polonais a produit de trÃ¨s belles histoires d'amour qui non seulement vous divertiront mais vous aideront aussi Ã  comprendre le cÅ“ur et l'Ã¢me polonais.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="OglÄ…damy film"
  translation="Nous regardons un film"
  pronunciation="[og-OUON-da-mi film]"
  context="La phrase parfaite pour commencer votre soirÃ©e cinÃ©ma ensemble."
/>

## Films romantiques polonais classiques

### Seksmisja (Sexmission) - 1984

Cette **komedia science fiction** (comÃ©die de science-fiction) est devenue un film culte en Pologne. Bien que principalement une comÃ©die sur deux hommes qui se rÃ©veillent dans un futur dirigÃ© entiÃ¨rement par des femmes, elle contient de beaux Ã©lÃ©ments romantiques et illustre parfaitement l'humour polonais. Les **dialogi** (dialogues) sont pleins d'esprit et vous aideront Ã  apprendre des expressions polonaises familiÃ¨res.

<VocabCard
  word="Åšmieszne"
  translation="DrÃ´le"
  pronunciation="[CHMIÃˆCH-nÃ©]"
  example="Ten film jest bardzo Å›mieszny."
/>

### Czterdziestolatek (Le QuadragÃ©naire) - 1975

Originellement un **serial telewizyjny** (sÃ©rie tÃ©lÃ©visÃ©e) qui a Ã©tÃ© compilÃ© en films plus tard, cette histoire touchante suit Stefan Karwowski Ã  travers sa crise de la quarantaine et ses relations amoureuses. C'est considÃ©rÃ© comme l'un des portraits les plus authentiques de la vie et des relations polonaises des annÃ©es 1970.

## CinÃ©ma romantique polonais moderne

### Planeta Singli (PlanÃ¨te CÃ©libataires) - 2016

Cette **komedia romantyczna** (comÃ©die romantique) contemporaine suit plusieurs histoires d'amour interconnectÃ©es dans la Varsovie moderne. Elle capture parfaitement comment les jeunes Polonais naviguent dans les **zwiÄ…zki** (relations) Ã  l'Ã¨re numÃ©rique. Le film a gÃ©nÃ©rÃ© des suites et est devenu un phÃ©nomÃ¨ne, ce qui en fait un visionnage essentiel pour comprendre la romance polonaise moderne.

<VocabCard
  word="Randka"
  translation="Rendez-vous amoureux"
  pronunciation="[RAND-ka]"
  example="Dzisiaj mamy pierwszÄ… randkÄ™."
/>

### Jestem MordercÄ… (Je suis un tueur) - 2016

Bien que principalement un **thriller kryminalny** (thriller criminel), ce film contient une belle histoire d'amour en son cÅ“ur. BasÃ© sur des Ã©vÃ©nements rÃ©els, il montre comment l'amour peut endurer mÃªme les circonstances les plus difficiles. Le **scenariusz** (scÃ©nario) est magistralement Ã©crit et dÃ©fiera les apprenants de polonais de niveau intermÃ©diaire.

<CultureTip flag="ğŸ‡µğŸ‡±" title="ApprÃ©ciation du cinÃ©ma polonais">
Les spectateurs polonais adorent les films qui mÃ©langent les genres. Ne soyez pas surpris de trouver des Ã©lÃ©ments romantiques dans les thrillers, de la comÃ©die dans les drames, ou des thÃ¨mes philosophiques dans les histoires d'amour. Cela reflÃ¨te l'apprÃ©ciation polonaise de la complexitÃ© de la vie - quelque chose que les cinÃ©philes franÃ§ais peuvent Ã©galement apprÃ©cier.
</CultureTip>

## SuccÃ¨s internationaux avec des thÃ¨mes polonais

### Cold War (Zimna Wojna) - 2018

Ce chef-d'Å“uvre **czarno-biaÅ‚y** (en noir et blanc) de PaweÅ‚ Pawlikowski raconte l'histoire d'une liaison passionnÃ©e mais impossible entre un **muzyk** (musicien) et une **tancerka** (danseuse) sur fond de Guerre froide. Le film a remportÃ© de nombreux prix internationaux, dont le Prix de la mise en scÃ¨ne Ã  Cannes, et met en valeur la beautÃ© de la langue polonaise Ã  travers des **piosenki** (chansons) et de la poÃ©sie.

### Ida - 2013

Un autre film de Pawlikowski, ce drame oscarisÃ© suit une jeune **zakonnica** (nonne) qui dÃ©couvre ses origines juives. Bien que pas strictement une romance, il contient des Ã©lÃ©ments romantiques subtils et offre un aperÃ§u profond de l'histoire polonaise et de l'**toÅ¼samoÅ›Ä‡** (identitÃ©).

## Vocabulaire pour la soirÃ©e cinÃ©ma

| Polonais | FranÃ§ais | Prononciation |
|---|---|---|
| Kino | CinÃ©ma | KI-no |
| Bilet | Billet | BI-lÃ¨t |
| Popcorn | Pop-corn | POP-korn |
| Ekran | Ã‰cran | Ã‰-kran |
| KrzesÅ‚o | SiÃ¨ge | KCHÃ‰-souo |
| Ciemno | Sombre | TCHIÃ‰M-no |

<VocabCard
  word="Napisy"
  translation="Sous-titres"
  pronunciation="[NA-pi-si]"
  example="WÅ‚Ä…czamy polskie napisy."
/>

## Expressions utiles pour regarder un film

Apprendre ces expressions rendra votre **wieczÃ³r filmowy** (soirÃ©e cinÃ©ma) plus authentique :

- **Â« Co oglÄ…damy dziÅ› wieczorem? Â»** (Qu'est-ce qu'on regarde ce soir ?) - Â« tso og-OUON-da-mi djich viÃ©-TCHO-rÃ¨m Â»
- **Â« Ten film ma dobre recenzje Â»** (Ce film a de bonnes critiques) - Â« tÃ¨n film ma DO-brÃ© rÃ©-TSÃˆN-ziÃ© Â»
- **Â« PodobaÅ‚ mi siÄ™ ten aktor Â»** (J'ai aimÃ© cet acteur) - Â« po-do-BAOU mi chÃ© tÃ¨n AK-tor Â»
- **Â« To byÅ‚a piÄ™kna scena Â»** (C'Ã©tait une belle scÃ¨ne) - Â« to BI-oua PIÃˆN-kna STSÃ‰-na Â»

## CrÃ©er votre expÃ©rience cinÃ©ma polonaise

Pour maximiser votre apprentissage tout en apprÃ©ciant ces films ensemble :

1. **Commencez par les sous-titres** - DÃ©butez avec des **napisy francuskie** (sous-titres franÃ§ais), puis passez aux **napisy polskie** (sous-titres polonais)
2. **Faites des pauses et discutez** - ArrÃªtez le film pour discuter des nouveaux mots ou rÃ©fÃ©rences culturelles avec **Â« Co to znaczy? Â»** (Qu'est-ce que Ã§a veut dire ?)
3. **Tenez un carnet de vocabulaire** - Notez les nouveaux **sÅ‚Ã³wka** (mots) que vous rencontrez
4. **Regardez les scÃ¨nes deux fois** - Une premiÃ¨re fois pour l'histoire, une seconde pour la langue
5. **Pratiquez aprÃ¨s** - Utilisez les phrases du film dans vos propres conversations

<ConjugationTable
  verb="OglÄ…daÄ‡"
  meaning="regarder"
  conjugations={[
    { person: "Je", word: "oglÄ…dam", translation: "je regarde" },
    { person: "Tu (informel)", word: "oglÄ…dasz", translation: "tu regardes" },
    { person: "Il/Elle", word: "oglÄ…da", translation: "il/elle regarde" },
    { person: "Nous", word: "oglÄ…damy", translation: "nous regardons" },
    { person: "Vous (pluriel)", word: "oglÄ…dacie", translation: "vous regardez" },
    { person: "Ils/Elles", word: "oglÄ…dajÄ…", translation: "ils/elles regardent" }
